Reviews.Title: “hotel malu roma”
Reviews.Author: sillygurl5
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last June. Excellent location at a great price. 5minute walk to the Termini and lots of restaurants and shops. Makes for a good base to explore Roma. Clean and roomy, helpful and pleasant staff.

Reviews.Title: “From March 19 to March 23 we have stayed in Hotel Malù.”
Reviews.Author: Fransen-Bennebroek
Reviews.Content: From March 19 to March 23 we have stayed in Hotel Malu. The staff and the owners were very kind and friendly. It was as if they welcomed us at their home. The hotel is not what you expect from a hotel. The entrance of the hotel is at the first floor of an appartment building and can be reached by elevator or stairway to be reached from a court yard separated from the street and closed as from 20.00 hours. Of course, you’ll get a key so that you can come in whenever you like. Please note, that the stairway and the elevator does not give you a luxury feeling. However, once inside the hotel, there is nothing wrong with it. It has a cozy reception with a wifi connection. Our room was at the street side, very neat, tidy and very well cleaned. Nice beds, a small TV with local network and also a small but complete bathroom. Breakfast is from 08.00 to 10. something. The lady owner starts with your breakfast as soon as you come in. Fresh home made croissants, omelets, coffee, a complete choice of cheese and meat as well as jam, Nutella etc. The two of us together paid € 106 per night including continental breakfast and 10% VAT. Local tax was € 4 per night to be paid in cash. The hotel is at a 5 minutes walking distance from the Leonardo Express, the train that starts at Fiumicino (Leonardo da Vinci) Airport and without any stop ends at Termini station. From Termini station you can reach any point of interest by bus or subway. (In our case, we walked (and walked and walked and …) For € 1 per person you can buy a ticket for the bus. Please note that it is very crowed in the bus as it leaves the station and therefore impossible to buy your ticket in the bus. It is better to buy your ticket at the mobile ticket office in front of the busses. The hotel and Termini are located in the middle of a very lively area of the city. Many hotels, restaurants, shops etc., but also many street salesman with all kind of rubbish and beggars. Conclusion. Hotel Malu is a nice hotel where you can stay for an acceptable price in a friendly and kind atmosphere and enjoy an excellent breakfast. All the major points of interest, which are more or less located very close to each other, can be reached from the hotel by foot but also by bus. (I also addressed the negative review about this hotel which concerned a fire during the night. It will certainly not surprise anyone that the staff of the hotel has a different view on things.)

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location, wonderfully hospitable staff”
Reviews.Author: Salsad8
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideally located very close to the Termini in Rome, a very short walk. Although close to the station it was still a very quiet hotel, located off a large, lovely courtyard. The room was clean and the staff was very helpful and informative. The room was also very quiet, which is sometimes hard to find in Rome. Worthy of note, we forgot our camera in the room, being in a hurry to leave. After realizing our error, we called the hotel in a panic, knowing full well it was possible that the staff could say it wasn't found. Arianna and Dana couldn't have been more responsive. They went to the Post Office very quickly and had to go more than once since the P.O.s in Italy just aren't as efficient as in the States. Our camera arrived safely a few days later. Our vacation could have ended on a bad note but thanks to the staff at Hotel Malu our wonderful memories of Italy remain intact. We can't thank them enough.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly fine for the price.”
Reviews.Author: SSAN21
Reviews.Content: If you need to be near termini train station for an early flight you cant get much closer than his. We stayed for one night before leaving on a 7am flight to portugal so the location was awesome. For 75 euros the room was better than you'd expect. Pretty decent size and so was the bathroom. We had a room facing the courtyard and there was no outside noise at all coming in. Only downer was the older woman who i think was saying there being really loud and in the corridor until after 1 am talking on her phone and stomping up and down the corridor. There is no one in reception after 8pm so there wasn't anyone to tell her to be quiet or for us to even speak to about it. Would stay here again for a short stopover in rome.

Reviews.Title: “Superior hospitality, nice accomodations”
Reviews.Author: govsmart
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with 3 other couples, as one part of our Italy travel in early October. The host Ivan, was most gracious, and very helpful and informative. The rooms were clean and nicely appointed. We thoroughly enjoyed our 3-day stay, and the convenient location of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and clean”
Reviews.Author: Svartn
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for to nights and found the room very nice and clean. The hotel is close to termini, but can be a bit tricky to find (the Hotel sign is really small). We spent most of our days out of the hotel so can't say too much about staff but they seemed friendly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, comfortable stay and unbeatable location”
Reviews.Author: globalwanderer2
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently spent two nights in Rome during our European whirlwind tour via the rails. We booked in at the Hotel Malu' as it seemed like the best option based on price, location and the generally positive Trip Advisor reviews. That said, here's a summary of our experience: Rooms - We booked a superior room which was very clean, spacious and comfortable. We had two windows, one in the bedroom and one in the sitting area that both offered pleasant street views with minimal road noise (since the hotel is on a side street). Coupled with that, there are not one, but two A/C units for the bedroom and sitting area. The cool curved brick ceiling gives the whole room a very Romanesque feel. Front desk/staff: Very courteous and helpful and with no hassles checking in or out. The guy that we met upon arrival was great at showing us the best way to get around Rome and he offered very good advice. Location - One of the hotel's best features. The Malu is less than a 10 minute walk from Rome's main train station, but can be a little tricky to find since there's no sign outside of the hotel. Look for the corresponding street number address first, and you'll come to a large door with a buzzer box on the side. You'll see a listing for "Hotel Malu", press it, and you should be let in the large wooden door. Immediately as you walk in, you'll hit a small courtyard, where you make an immediate left. Take a couple more paces and you'll find an elevator and stairs. Walk/ride up to the 1st floor, turn left, and you should hit the reception desk for the hotel. Another plus: Its located off a quiet side street which makes it great for sleeping since there's very little road noise. We walked alot in Rome, and were able to walk to the Forum and Colosseum in just over 20 minutes. The bottom line - You simply cannot beat the Hotel Malu's perfect location and convenience. Very good value based on this alone, coupled with clean rooms and a nice Roman atmosphere. Five stars, and would definitely recommend to fellow travellers, particularly those arriving in Rome via the rails.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: sunjan
Reviews.Content: Super friendly and energetic front desk staff (young woman with her little sister as assistant, forgot their names). They made us feel very welcome, spoke good English, and gave helpful tips and directions to public transport. Location is perfect, just a few blocks from the Leonardo Express airport train to Fiumicino. The hotel will send you a map when you book, it's a side entrance of the Termino station and can be hard to find otherwise (enter on tack 24, walk along the platform until you reach track 28). No coffemaking facilities or English TV channels, but that's minor gripes. After all, cappucino on the street is great, and you're not in Rome to watch TV anyway, right?!

Reviews.Title: “Like spending time with family”
Reviews.Author: Dancingbear6
Reviews.Content: Stayed pre-transatlantic cruise 10/19-10/22. Great location, near transportation, off/on tour buses. Safe well maintained neighborhood. Room was substantial, Italian minimalist, stucco walls with original terra cotta ceilings.A large double window opens onto street below.European breakfast served mornings in a beautiful breakfast room. Close windows and zero street noise results. Staff very accommodating and helpful. No request denied. On second floor of large pre-war building with courtyard, served by small but efficient elevator. You or your luggage but not both at the same time.All of Ivan's suggestions were right on.Very articulate young man who is very proud of his city. Lives in the building next door, but noone at desk after 8pm. The days we were there, The hotel was always full with guests arriving and departing based on train/plane arrivals. Guests were European, British, Italian,American, young students and cruisers.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money, good location.”
Reviews.Author: lbtravel_09
Reviews.Content: When we booked this hotel, the main reason was that hotel located really close to the train station, that was important since we arrived and departure from Termini. We expected some noise, but decided it would be OK since it's only for 1 night. Being in Rome many times and staying in many different hotels, we were pleasantly surprised that hotel located in such busy/crowded area near Termini station could be so nice and quiet. The room was big enough and very clean; overlooking the cozy courtyard; modern, interesting room interior, spacious bathroom. Good value for the money, good location.

Reviews.Title: “Electrical Fire in Our Room - Hostile/Aggressive Owner”
Reviews.Author: VrstaSira
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Malu for three nights during our honeymoon September of this year. While there we had the most horrifying travel experience of our lives. The second night we were there we went to bed early. A few hours later I was awoken by the smell of smoke. No alarm went off (this hotel is in a high rise building and has no smoke detectors). We were unable to get out of the room because it was pitch black (due to black out shutters), the electrical fuse had blown so no lights would turn on, and the door would not unlock from the inside without a key which we could not find in the dark. After struggling to find the key and finally getting the door unlocked the night watchman refused to call for help. Our room was full of electrical smoke and we saw that part of the air conditioner was melted through. No matter how many times we asked the night attendant to call for help he would not. We then realized there were no phones in the hotel rooms as well so we were unable to call for help ourselves. Our room wreaked of burnt plastic and was full of white toxic smoke. Then the night attendant (who turned out to be the owner's father) flipped the circuit breaker back on which caused the electrical fire to start burning out of the control. The entire floor was now full of smoke and tons of other guests were coming out of their rooms coughing. The night attendant still refused to call the fire department. My husband was running in and out of the room desperately trying to find our passports and valuables while coughing hysterically. All of our clothes and belongings ended up being randomly flung all over the breakfast room. All of our clothes smelled horrible like burnt plastic. The owner did not show up until well after the fire had happened (even though he lives in the same building as the hotel - it seemed he did not want to be witness to what was happening so he could deny how bad it was later). When he did show up he was completely unapologetic. He moved us to a new room and then told us we could talk about what happened the next morning. The next morning he was not in the hotel at all. Because of this we sent an email that a friend of ours translated into Italian asking him to have our clothes laundered and refund us for the night of the fire. We went out for the day and came back in the afternoon. When we returned the owner ATTACKED my husband and accused us of setting fire to the room. He and his father came up with a lie and said we had placed something on the air conditioner and that caused the fire. We NEVER placed anything on the air conditioner. It was clearly in disrepair. Then, he accused my husband and I (in a raised voice) of ruining the night for the rest of the guests by daring to have a fire in our room. It was unbelievable. At the end of this deranged conversation he announced that he had spent the whole day calling the company we booked with and our credit card company to tell them it was all our fault. The owner was clearly covering up because he knew that he had endangered his guests. It was truly disgusting. This hotel is not safe, and I do not recommend staying here unless you want to play Russian roulette with your life. All the other hotels we stayed at in Italy had phones in the rooms as well as fire detectors besides Hotel Malu. Find a safe hotel in Rome and stay there instead.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, very convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Jsweat
Reviews.Content: Hotel Malu is a good value and has a great location near the Termini station. While the area is seedy in places and there are a lot of touristy restaurants, we really appreciated the convenience. The staff was friendly and helpful and we had a very pleasant stay. Our room overlooked the courtyard in the back and was quiet and pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Believe the reviews”
Reviews.Author: hhislim
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel based on TA reviews, location & price. This hotel is for budget minded people who don't mind spartan, small and clean room. We were only staying one night so it met our needs. I would recommend this place to others with similar needs. As noted by others, the staff was friendly and helpful. In the Termini area, there apparently are many small hotels - often in same building. One quirk was limited reception hours. If you were leaving early or arriving after 8:00pm - you needed to make special arrangements. The hours did not impact us - but if I was a stranger arriving late - I sure would prefer to see a desk attendant.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Bricneach
Reviews.Content: Great location, close to train. Very clean rooms, helpful and pleasant staff. If I had to pick one thing to improve experience, being able to use courtyard would be it. There were signs prohibiting loitering in the courtyard. Would still stay here again on return trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “a Very convenient and pleasant stay in the heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: Yarakm
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my husband at Hotel Malu for 4 nights on August 19, 2011 as part of our Italy trip this summer, and we did not regret it. First the location: it is a walking distance (with luggage) from the Roma Termini which is the main train station, and in the heart of the city, as it is within a walking distance from the Colosseo as well (15 min). there is even a laundry opposite the hotel. Second the service: the team are extremely nice and very helpful, Dana at Check in gave us the map and some directions on how to get to the main city attractions, Ivan and Arianna were of a continuous help during our stay, and Maria (que non parla l'inglese) was very kind every morning to get us what we needed for a perfect breakfast. Third the room: the room was very clean and neat, with AC and a hairdryer, with only one small problem, as while we were taking the shower, the hot water would be on and off for some reason... (you'd rather mention it upon check in if you are staying during winter time). apart from that, everything was great, i would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Rome, as we would sure book it the next time we decide to go :)

Reviews.Title: “One of My Best Finds”
Reviews.Author: aseeny
Reviews.Content: This hotel is easliy accessible.A very short walk from the city's main metro station.Conveniences for travellers at the doorstep - laundry,shops,eating places,shopping centres.All Rome and Vatican City can be accessed from here via Rome's underground and buses.The hotel provided top-notched services - spanking clean room,quiet location ( eventhough in city centre),while the staff are very attentive to guests' well-being.All this are offered at affordable charges.I am planning my return next year.Very homely,warm and secured.Good place to be home after a long,tiring trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: redbirdfever
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Malu one night before we left on a cruise from Rome's port Civitavecchia. This hotel is very close to the main train station fo Rome and was delightful. The staff was very helpful and spoke good English. The rooms were each decorated differently and we really enjoyed the atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value in Rome”
Reviews.Author: jmcgavock
Reviews.Content: We stayed here based on TripAdvisor reviews and were very satisfied. Ivan and his mother were very gracious hosts. Our room had a nice brick domed ceiling, with a nice lighting feature. The rooms were very clean. We enjoyed the continental breakfast. This is not the Ritz, but was perfect for our needs and budget. We would definitely stay here again if we visit Rome in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay again”
Reviews.Author: YoAndyB
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights end of May 2011. Good size room with character. Service good and friendly, especially at breakfast - Eu8 each, but well worth it. We found the bed comfortable and slept very well - didn't really notice any noise. Although only 5 min walk from Termini station, the surrounding streets were relatively clean and quiet, and we never felt unsafe, even when returning late at night. If staying for a few days it is well worth buying a travel pass - Eu25 and includes unlimited tram, metro, bus and open top bus tour.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Rome for the price”
Reviews.Author: tauernhof
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Rome & stayed at the Malu before our cruise & in another hotel at the end. The Malu is PERFECT! Great location, staff, clean rooms (run AC if hall is noisy), delicious breakfast (great value) and better than the 4 star hotel we stayed in after our cruise. Remember you are in an ancient city & the hotel rooms are not as large as North American rooms, but is was perfect in every way!

Reviews.Title: “Great base to explore”
Reviews.Author: Keithyboy25
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights here for my 30th birthday. The hotel was a perfect base to explore from with a decent continental-style breakfast available each morning and extremely helpful staff giving it a very laid back feel. The only small negatives are that noise does travel so you are aware of people coming back late in the evening but this should not be a problem as you will be sound asleep having walked and eaten yourself into the ground! If we return to Rome we will be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & charming hotel, friendly staff, awesome location!”
Reviews.Author: DZAmberG
Reviews.Content: This hotel is less than a five minute walk to the Termini train station in Rome. It's also in walking distance to many touristy sites. On day we took the subway to the other end of town to see the spanish steps and made our way through all the other sites on foot, finally ending at our hotel. More importantly, this hotel was clean. And it had all the basic ammenities we needed - a/c, private bathroom, hairdryer... As added bonuses it also had lots of character and a great staff. Our first room (we stayed there twice) was really charming and even had a little balcony that looked out onto a very picturesque courtyard. They also had a good breakfast available. We were very pleased with our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Nice location at a good price”
Reviews.Author: Boston41
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Malu for 4 nights in mid-April and very much enjoyed it. Upsides: The location is fantastic. It is only a few blocks from Termini Station (trains, train to airport, subway), there are restaurants nearby, and it's an easy 5-25 minute walk to a lot of the main sights. The staff is very polite and helpful with any question. Our room was comfortable though small, but a good value for the money. Downsides: We were in a room next to the office so we got wifi, otherwise you need to set up in the breakfast room to get wifi -- the system also allowed only 4 computers/phones on the wifi at a time (though we never had a problem getting on). The walls are a little thin and our door jostled every time somebody exited the hotel. Would I recommend it? You bet! As I said, great value for the money!

Reviews.Title: “Good location helpful staff a few more facilities would be welcome”
Reviews.Author: Atulwalia
Reviews.Content: first all: this is a budget hotel so expect accordingly and you will not be disappointed first time in Italy and Stayed in the hotel end of march for 4 nights.. location was great near Termini station (5-10) min walk) and didnt have to spend more than 15-20 min getting anywhere in rome.. lots of eating places nearby with good enough food for travellers of all budgets the room and bathrooms were clean, good security and clean towels. even did a flower decoration for us which I had requested. The staff Dana and Ivan were fantastic and very helpful even going to the length iof searching the internet for some restaurants for us( we being vegeterians) However I think the price was a bit high since breakfast was not included and people might find equivalent hotels offering the same. also the TV was small with no english channels (I think this is case in most of hotels) We didnt mind as we went on the trip with a view of spending a lot of time outdoors and not watching TV and picked up a quick breakfast at the Termini/ nearby places.

Reviews.Title: “Located very near to Termini;”
Reviews.Author: amrotefa
Reviews.Content: Pros: -Location; 5 minutes walk from Termini where you may go anywhere -Friendly service Cons: -Wifi coverage not in all rooms, ours had coverage though -Walls are very thin so you could hear some noises from reception and corridors Overall it is a good and recommended hotel. Loved the owners.

Reviews.Title: “will definitely come back!”
Reviews.Author: Pammie425
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Hotel Malu for 3 nights. Very cute, comfy hotel. Great location, very close to Termini, but not noisy. The staff is very friendly, helpful and patient, speak good english. Room is cosy, clean and characterful. I felt it warm when I stayed in this hotel. Will definitely come back if I visit Rome again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff and buona colazione”
Reviews.Author: KevanTaiwan
Reviews.Content: I stay just for one day and leave to Firenze, but I will consider to say more longer next time in Roma, It gives me a very good impression at first day in Italy!

Reviews.Title: “Well located, clean basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rigobluenose
Reviews.Content: Staying for 2 nights this hotel was ideally located and spotlessly clean. The entrance Is found through a residential court yard like many Rome hotels. Check in is at 12 which is great when your on an early flight and the team are really friendly. The rooms are very basic, tiled floors, bed and desk. This is not a hotel for a treat but its priced well for Rome and just around the corner from Termini. The En-suit was tiny and built into the room which means the noise travelled. We had a street facing room and it ŵas noisy even with double glazing. Breakfast was nice, simple continental. Wouldn't advise people against staying here however We will stay somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience and wonderful staff - great Rome value.”
Reviews.Author: Mike-Kathy
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a one night stay in Rome close to Termini train station before going to the Amalfi Coast. This not only fit the bill, it greatly exceeded our expectations. The area is clean, safe, well lit and surrounded by cute sidewalk cafes. The hotel lobby is on the second floor with a lift from the courtyard. The staff greeted us and let us check in early. They offered advice on getting around Rome and seeing the sites. The room was not small at all. It had a nice domed brick ceiling and shutters opening to the courtyard. Standard European continental breakfast included. For the price you just cannot beat the Malu!

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Beatuful hotel”
Reviews.Author: cjdebra
Reviews.Content: we came to Rome for 3 nights, our trip first night and last 2 nights, visit time very late or very early, but hotel malu always welcome to us so nice, it's lovely. enjoy the room and breakfast, the people of hotel malu so nice and considerate. we all love to stayed hotel malu. nice place.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, best value in Rome”
Reviews.Author: anisa47
Reviews.Content: Great location near Termini station. A short walk to the collosseum & forum (about 15 min only). We took the metro only to go Vatican city. The hotel is very peaceful and well decorated. It is VERY clean, quite modern and comfortable. I recommend it !

Reviews.Title: “Really nice family run place”
Reviews.Author: Dog40
Reviews.Content: The family running this place are super nice. And the location is great, close to the main train/metro station, so you can get around the city easily, but on a quiet street with rooms facing an inner courtyard, so there is no noise. For the price, I think it's great and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here and feel like you're with family”
Reviews.Author: sunnygirlLA
Reviews.Content: Wonderful little rooms, impeccably clean, nice and quiet at night. Incredibly friendly owners who went out of their way to accommodate us. We didn't put our names out for breakfast the night before, and came out in the morning after they had served everyone else, but they went out of their way to provide us with breakfast, which was plentiful. We were caught in a dilemma with check out, as we forgot to set our clocks ahead, and we over-stayed our visit a bit, but they never made us feel like it. In fact, they served us breakfast with a smile, and held our bags for us all day while we walked to the colosseum and waited for check in at our next place. The woman running the place was incredibly kind. I felt kind of bad during breakfast because I kept asking for more coffee, but not only did she bring me more espresso, she brought a couple of desert pastries along with it. I couldn't communicate much with her because my Italian is so limited, but it didn't matter because her warm smile and friendly hospitality spoke for itself. Same goes for the young man who works there as well. Anything we needed, he had. His English was very good, and I was able to have some good conversation with him while we stayed. Easy walks to the colosseum/ forum/etc. Very conveniently located to termini station. Had a great stay, and would go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Beutiful hotel and great people”
Reviews.Author: WaveFrog
Reviews.Content: This place far exceeded our expectations, especially considering the price. It's newly remodeled and quite comfortable. There's free wifi (that doesn't block Skype or Facebook) in the reception area which is a great place to meet other guests. Ivan is very helpful and fun to talk with too.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Malu'
HotelInfo.Address: Via Principe Amedeo 85/a, 00185 Rome, Italy
